metadata.notes: All data extracted from official government sources. Costs verified as of research date. Contact departments for most current fees.

cities.name: Los Angeles

permits.description: Required for all food trucks selling unpackaged foods in LA County
permits.issuingAgency: LA County Department of Public Health

permits.description: For trucks selling only prepackaged food items
permits.issuingAgency: LA County Department of Public Health

permits.description: For food carts selling unpackaged foods
permits.issuingAgency: LA County Department of Public Health

permits.description: Required for new mobile food facility approval
permits.issuingAgency: LA County Department of Public Health - Vehicle Inspection Plan Check Program

permits.description: Required for all employees handling food
permits.issuingAgency: LA County Department of Public Health

permits.description: Required for at least one designated manager
requirements: Pass certified food protection manager exam

healthDept.name: LA County Department of Public Health - Environmental Health

restrictions: Must operate from a licensed commissary
Cannot park at metered spaces without paying
Must provide trash receptacle
Can only serve customers on sidewalk side (not roadside)
Need bathroom access within 200 ft if operating over 1 hour at one location
notes: LA County permits are valid in most cities in the county
Long Beach, Pasadena, and Vernon have their own health departments - separate permits may be required
Fees updated March 2024

cities.name: New York

permits.description: Required for any individual working on a food cart or truck
permits.issuingAgency: NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
requirements: Pass Food Protection Course for Mobile Vendors

permits.type: Mobile Food Vending Unit Permit (Full-Term) - Food Prepared On-Site
permits.description: Required for each food truck/cart where food is prepared
permits.issuingAgency: NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
requirements: Certificate of Authority to collect sales tax

permits.type: Mobile Food Vending Unit Permit (Full-Term) - Prepackaged
permits.description: For units selling prepackaged foods only
permits.issuingAgency: NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
requirements: Certificate of Authority to collect sales tax

permits.type: Food Protection Course for Mobile Vendors
permits.description: Mandatory training course

healthDept.name: NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene

restrictions: Number of permits is limited by law - waitlists apply
Cannot vend on restricted streets (see NYC guide)
Must be serviced at approved commissary daily
Must post letter grade from inspections
Cannot operate within 200 feet of school when in session (varies by zone)
Supervisory license required for certain permits
notes: NYC has one of the most restrictive food truck permit systems
Waitlists for full-term permits can be years long
Restricted Area Permits available without waitlist for private property
Veterans may qualify for fee waivers

cities.name: Portland

permits.description: Required annual license for food carts/trucks
For high-risk food operations
Required for new carts or major remodels
Expedited plan review
Required if your cart needs a commissary
Required for all food service workers
Required for all businesses
Required for carts using propane

restrictions: Must be on wheels and moveable at all times
Cannot have permanent utility connections
Must have built-in fresh and grey water tanks
Cannot require ODOT special permit to move
Residential area vending limited to 10 minutes per block
notes: Portland is famous for its food cart pods
Spanish and Vietnamese speaking staff available at Environmental Health
Food cart pods with 2+ carts need additional site permits

cities.name: Houston

permits.description: Required for all food trucks operating in Houston
Required for mobile food unit operators
permits.issuingAgency: Texas Dept. of State Health Services approved providers

permits.description: Required for selling taxable goods

healthDept.name: Houston Health Department - Consumer Health Services Bureau

restrictions: Must operate from Central Preparation Facility (commissary)
Must report to CPF daily for supplies and cleaning
Potable and waste water tanks must be labeled
3-compartment sink required for utensil washing
notes: Texas Senate Bill 1008 aligns Houston with state regulations effective Sept 2025
Effective July 2026, Texas will issue statewide medallion/permit
GPS devices no longer required under new rules

cities.name: Austin

permits.description: Required for all mobile food establishments
permits.issuingAgency: Austin Public Health - Environmental Health Services

permits.description: Required for trucks with propane or electric appliances
Required for all food establishments
Required for all employees who handle food
requirements: Complete food handler course within 30 days of employment

healthDept.name: Austin Public Health - Environmental Health Services

restrictions: Must operate from licensed Central Preparation Facility
Must have restroom access agreement
Cannot expand operations outside approved mobile food establishment area
Must follow all Texas Food Establishment Rules
notes: Austin offers on-site mobile vending permitting for renewals within city limits
Lottery system for on-site inspections due to high demand
All applications now submitted through My Health Department portal

cities.name: Miami

permits.description: State license required for food trucks
permits.issuingAgency: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services (FDACS)

permits.type: City of Miami Business Tax Receipt
permits.description: Required for operating within Miami city limits
permits.issuingAgency: City of Miami Department of Finance

permits.description: County-level permit for mobile operations

healthDept.name: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services

restrictions: Street vending prohibited in certain locations
Special vending districts have specific restrictions
Cannot block sidewalks or pedestrian traffic
Food truck roundups on private property need special approval
notes: Florida uses state-level food licensing through FDACS
Miami-Dade County has additional zoning requirements
City of Miami has special vending districts with restrictions

cities.name: Chicago

permits.description: For food trucks that prepare food on-site
permits.issuingAgency: Chicago Department of Business Affairs and Consumer Protection
requirements: City of Chicago Food Sanitation Manager Certificate

permits.description: For trucks selling prepackaged/wrapped food only
permits.issuingAgency: Chicago Department of Business Affairs and Consumer Protection
requirements: Retail Food Establishment license (if producing food)

permits.description: Required for vehicles with propane, gas, generators, or fire suppression
Required if fire suppression system installed
documents: Fire suppression plans on company letterhead

permits.description: Required for Mobile Food Preparers

healthDept.name: Chicago Department of Public Health - Food Protection Division

restrictions: Must park at least 200 feet from any restaurant entrance (except 12AM-2AM)
Maximum 4 hours in any one block
Hours of operation: 5AM - 2AM
No more than 40 pounds of propane
No sound-amplifying devices
Cannot operate on privately-owned vacant lots
GPS must be operational when vending
notes: Chicago has designated food truck stands in various locations
Free MFV assessment available before applying
All food must be prepared at commissary or shared kitchen - no residential prep

cities.name: Denver

permits.description: Required annual license for food trucks and carts
permits.issuingAgency: City and County of Denver - Department of Licensing and Consumer Protection
permits.processingTime: 5+ business days for review, up to 30 days total in busy season

permits.description: Required if using propane
requirements: Hood suppression system inspection report (if applicable)

permits.description: Required for operating on private property
For food trucks operating as part of events

healthDept.name: Denver Department of Public Health and Environment

restrictions: Not allowed within 20 feet of intersection when selling
Not allowed in Central Business District
Not allowed within 300 feet of parks unless part of permitted event
Not allowed in residential zone districts
Must be at least 10 feet from other food trucks
Operations must be at least 50 feet from residential zones
notes: Denver has dedicated food truck zones in Lower Downtown (LoDo) on weekends
License is valid statewide in Colorado
No longer required to stay 200 feet from restaurants (recent zoning change)

cities.name: Seattle

permits.description: Required health permit for food trucks and carts
Required for food trucks and trailers
permits.issuingAgency: Washington State Department of Labor and Industries

permits.type: Seattle Fire Department Food Vendor Permit
permits.description: Required for vendors using propane, solid fuel, or open flame
Required for vending on public right-of-way
Required for all businesses
Required for all businesses

restrictions: Must be within 500 feet of restroom with hot water
Commissary must be within King County
King County health permits not valid in other counties
Portable toilets not allowed for restroom requirement
notes: WA State Fire Marshals have statewide food truck inspection program
Inspection from one participating agency recognized by others
Food carts do not require L&I approval

cities.name: San Francisco

permits.description: Required health permit for all mobile food operations
permits.issuingAgency: San Francisco Department of Public Health
requirements: Food Handler Cards for all employees

permits.description: Required for operating on public property
permits.issuingAgency: San Francisco Department of Public Works

permits.description: Required for operating on private property
Required for Classification 4-5 mobile food facilities
permits.issuingAgency: California Department of Housing and Community Development

permits.description: Required for all businesses
permits.issuingAgency: SF Office of the Treasurer and Tax Collector

healthDept.name: San Francisco Department of Public Health - Environmental Health

restrictions: Must stay 75 feet from any restaurant
Must stay 500 feet from grade schools
Neighborhood notification required for public property
Buffer zones in certain areas (Gaslamp Quarter, Little Italy equivalent)
notes: SF has 5 classification levels based on food preparation complexity
Private organizers like Off the Grid operate on private property with their own permits
Free small business counseling available from Office of Small Business

cities.name: Dallas

permits.type: Mobile Food Prep Vehicle/Trailer Permit (Class III/IV)
permits.description: Required for full-service food trucks
permits.issuingAgency: Dallas Code Compliance - Consumer Health Division

permits.description: One-time application processing fee
permits.issuingAgency: Dallas Code Compliance - Consumer Health Division

permits.description: Required for new trucks
permits.issuingAgency: Dallas Code Compliance - Consumer Health Division

permits.description: For Class I/II mobile units with limited menus
permits.issuingAgency: Dallas Code Compliance - Consumer Health Division

permits.description: Required for all food establishments
Required if using propane

healthDept.name: Dallas Code Compliance - Consumer Health Division

restrictions: Must visit commissary daily
All menus must be pre-approved
Mobile units must be commercially manufactured
Written property owner agreement required for vending location
Restroom access required
notes: Appointments required for all permit applications
Inspections conducted on Thursdays 9AM-3:30PM at commissary or vending location
No cash accepted - credit/debit or check only

cities.name: Phoenix

permits.description: City license for operating at a specific location
permits.issuingAgency: City of Phoenix City Clerk - License Services

permits.description: Required health permit from county
permits.cost: varies by type (Type I, II, III)

permits.description: State sales tax permit

restrictions: License is location-specific - one license per location
Cannot visit multiple sites for more than 30 minutes each under same license
Must comply with local/city rules in addition to county
Private property vending requires property owner permission
notes: City of Phoenix does not issue general business licenses
Mobile Food Type I, II, III approved for farmers markets, events, business locations
Check with local cities within Maricopa County for additional requirements

cities.name: San Diego

permits.description: Required county health permit for food trucks
permits.issuingAgency: San Diego County Department of Environmental Health and Quality

permits.description: Required for operating on private property within city limits
permits.issuingAgency: City of San Diego Development Services

permits.description: Required for all businesses

healthDept.name: San Diego County Department of Environmental Health and Quality

restrictions: Not allowed in Parking Impact Overlay Zone in public right-of-way
Gaslamp Quarter: daily operations prohibited except as part of special events
Little Italy NC Zone: restrictions apply
Must have valid county health permit before city permit
notes: Many exemptions available including industrial zones, schools, hospitals, construction sites
On-street operations in most areas don't require city permit
Letter grading system implemented for food trucks
Spanish language resources available
